x-enum-elements.name: LEAST_EXPENSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The least expensive matched products are excluded from the pricing. If
the pricing rule is set to exclude one product and multiple products in the
match set qualify as least expensive, then one will be excluded at random.

Excluding the least expensive product gives the best discount value to the buyer.

x-enum-elements.name: MOST_EXPENSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The most expensive matched product is excluded from the pricing rule.
If multiple products have the same price and all qualify as least expensive,
one will be excluded at random.

This guarantees that the most expensive product is purchased at full price.

ExcludeStrategy.description:
Indicates which products matched by a CatalogPricingRule
will be excluded if the pricing rule uses an exclude set.

x-enum-elements.name: SCHEDULED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates the fulfillment to deliver at a scheduled deliver time.

x-enum-elements.name: ASAP
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the fulfillment to deliver as soon as possible and should be prepared
immediately.

FulfillmentDeliveryDetailsOrderFulfillme.description: The schedule type of the delivery fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: ALL
x-enum-elements.description: If `ALL`, `entries` must be unset.

x-enum-elements.name: ENTRY_LIST
x-enum-elements.description: If `ENTRY_LIST`, supply a list of `entries`.

FulfillmentFulfillmentLineItemApplicatio.description:
The `line_item_application` describes what order line items this fulfillment applies
to. It can be `ALL` or `ENTRY_LIST` with a supplied list of fulfillment entries.

x-enum-elements.name: SCHEDULED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment will be picked up at a scheduled pickup time.

x-enum-elements.name: ASAP
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the fulfillment will be picked up as soon as possible and
should be prepared immediately.

FulfillmentPickupDetailsScheduleType.description: The schedule type of the pickup fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: PROPOSED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment has been proposed.

x-enum-elements.name: RESERVED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment has been reserved.

x-enum-elements.name: PREPARED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment has been prepared.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLETED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment was successfully completed.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment was canceled.

x-enum-elements.name: FAILED
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the fulfillment failed to be completed, but was not explicitly
canceled.

FulfillmentState.description: The current state of this fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: PICKUP
x-enum-elements.description: A recipient to pick up the fulfillment from a physical [location](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/Location).

x-enum-elements.name: SHIPMENT
x-enum-elements.description: A shipping carrier to ship the fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: DELIVERY
x-enum-elements.description: A courier to deliver the fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: SUSPICIOUS_ACTIVITY
x-enum-elements.description:
The balance was decreased because the seller detected suspicious or fraudulent activity
on the gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: BALANCE_ACCIDENTALLY_INCREASED
x-enum-elements.description: The balance was decreased to reverse an unintentional balance increase.

x-enum-elements.name: SUPPORT_ISSUE
x-enum-elements.description: The balance was decreased to accommodate support issues.

x-enum-elements.name: PURCHASE_WAS_REFUNDED
x-enum-elements.description:
The balance was decreased because the order used to purchase or reload the
gift card was refunded.

GiftCardActivityAdjustDecrementReason.description: Indicates the reason for deducting money from a [gift card](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/GiftCard).

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLIMENTARY
x-enum-elements.description: The seller gifted a complimentary gift card balance increase.

x-enum-elements.name: SUPPORT_ISSUE
x-enum-elements.description:
The seller increased the gift card balance 
to accommodate support issues.

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSACTION_VOIDED
x-enum-elements.description: The transaction is voided.

GiftCardActivityAdjustIncrementReason.description: Indicates the reason for adding money to a [gift card](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/GiftCard).

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGEBACK_BLOCK
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card is blocked because the buyer initiated a chargeback on the gift card purchase.

GiftCardActivityBlockReason.description: Indicates the reason for blocking a [gift card](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/GiftCard).

x-enum-elements.name: SUSPICIOUS_ACTIVITY
x-enum-elements.description: The seller suspects suspicious activity.

x-enum-elements.name: REUSE_GIFTCARD
x-enum-elements.description: The seller cleared the balance to reuse the gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_REASON
x-enum-elements.description:
The gift card balance was cleared for an unknown reason.

This reason is read-only and cannot be used to create a `CLEAR_BALANCE` activity using the Gift Card Activities API.

GiftCardActivityClearBalanceReason.description: Indicates the reason for clearing the balance of a [gift card](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/GiftCard).

x-enum-elements.name: SUSPICIOUS_ACTIVITY
x-enum-elements.description: The seller suspects suspicious activity.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_REASON
x-enum-elements.description:
The gift card was deactivated for an unknown reason.

This reason is read-only and cannot be used to create a `DEACTIVATE` activity using the Gift Card Activities API.

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGEBACK_DEACTIVATE
x-enum-elements.description:
A chargeback on the gift card purchase (or the gift card load) was ruled in favor of the buyer.

This reason is read-only and cannot be used to create a `DEACTIVATE` activity using the Gift Card Activities API.

GiftCardActivityDeactivateReason.description: Indicates the reason for deactivating a [gift card](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/GiftCard).

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description:
The gift card redemption is pending. `PENDING` is a temporary status that applies when a 
gift card is redeemed from Square Point of Sale or another Square product. A `PENDING` status is updated to 
`COMPLETED` if the payment is captured or `CANCELED` if the authorization is voided.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLETED
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card redemption is completed.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description:
The gift card redemption is canceled. A redemption is canceled if the authorization 
on the gift card is voided.

GiftCardActivityRedeemStatus.description:
Indicates the status of a [gift card](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/GiftCard) redemption. This status is relevant only for
redemptions made from Square products (such as Square Point of Sale) because Square products use a 
two-state process. Gift cards redeemed using the Gift Card Activities API always have a `COMPLETED` status.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVATE
x-enum-elements.description:
Activated a gift card with a balance. When a gift card is activated, Square changes 
the gift card state from `PENDING` to `ACTIVE`. A gift card must be in the `ACTIVE` state 
to be used for other balance-changing activities.

x-enum-elements.name: LOAD
x-enum-elements.description: Loaded a gift card with additional funds.

x-enum-elements.name: REDEEM
x-enum-elements.description: Redeemed a gift card for a purchase.

x-enum-elements.name: CLEAR_BALANCE
x-enum-elements.description: Set the balance of a gift card to zero.

x-enum-elements.name: DEACTIVATE
x-enum-elements.description: Permanently blocked a gift card from balance-changing activities.

x-enum-elements.name: ADJUST_INCREMENT
x-enum-elements.description: Added money to a gift card outside of a typical `ACTIVATE`, `LOAD`, or `REFUND` activity flow.

x-enum-elements.name: ADJUST_DECREMENT
x-enum-elements.description: Deducted money from a gift card outside of a typical `REDEEM` activity flow.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUND
x-enum-elements.description:
Added money to a gift card from a refunded transaction. A `REFUND` activity might be linked to 
a Square payment, depending on how the payment and refund are processed. For example:
- A gift card payment processed by Square can be refunded to the same gift card using Square Point of Sale,
the Square Seller Dashboard, or the Refunds API.
- A cross-tender payment processed by Square can be refunded to a gift card using Square Point of Sale or the
Square Seller Dashboard. The payment source might be a credit card or different gift card.
- A payment processed using a custom payment processing system can be refunded to the same gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: UNLINKED_ACTIVITY_REFUND
x-enum-elements.description:
Added money to a gift card from a refunded transaction that was processed using a custom payment
processing system and not linked to the gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPORT
x-enum-elements.description:
Imported a third-party gift card with a balance. `IMPORT` activities are managed 
by Square and cannot be created using the Gift Card Activities API.

x-enum-elements.name: BLOCK
x-enum-elements.description:
Temporarily blocked a gift card from balance-changing activities. `BLOCK` activities 
are managed by Square and cannot be created using the Gift Card Activities API.

x-enum-elements.name: UNBLOCK
x-enum-elements.description:
Unblocked a gift card, which enables it to resume balance-changing activities. `UNBLOCK` 
activities are managed by Square and cannot be created using the Gift Card Activities API.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPORT_REVERSAL
x-enum-elements.description:
Reversed the import of a third-party gift card, which sets the gift card state to 
`PENDING` and clears the balance. `IMPORT_REVERSAL` activities are managed by Square and 
cannot be created using the Gift Card Activities API.

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSFER_BALANCE_FROM
x-enum-elements.description:
Deducted money from a gift card as the result of a transfer to the balance of another gift card.
`TRANSFER_BALANCE_FROM` activities are managed by Square and cannot be created using the Gift Card Activities API.

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSFER_BALANCE_TO
x-enum-elements.description:
Added money to a gift card as the result of a transfer from the balance of another gift card.
`TRANSFER_BALANCE_TO` activities are managed by Square and cannot be created using the Gift Card Activities API.

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGEBACK_UNBLOCK
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card is unblocked because a chargeback was ruled in favor of the seller.

GiftCardActivityUnblockReason.description: Indicates the reason for unblocking a [gift card](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/GiftCard).

x-enum-elements.name: SQUARE
x-enum-elements.description: The GAN is generated by Square.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER
x-enum-elements.description:
The GAN is provided by a non-Square system. For more information, see 
[Custom GANs](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/gift-cards/using-gift-cards-api#custom-gans) or 
[Third-party gift cards](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/gift-cards/using-gift-cards-api#third-party-gift-cards).

GiftCardGANSource.description:
Indicates the source that generated the gift card 
account number (GAN).

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: The gift card is active and can be used as a payment source.

x-enum-elements.name: DEACTIVATED
x-enum-elements.description: Any activity that changes the gift card balance is permanently forbidden.

x-enum-elements.name: BLOCKED
x-enum-elements.description: Any activity that changes the gift card balance is temporarily forbidden.

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description:
The gift card is pending activation.
This is the initial state when a gift card is created. You must activate the gift card
before it can be used.

x-enum-elements.name: PHYSICAL
x-enum-elements.description: A plastic gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: DIGITAL
x-enum-elements.description: A digital gift card.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description: The variation does not display an alert.

x-enum-elements.name: LOW_QUANTITY
x-enum-elements.description: The variation generates an alert when its quantity is low.

InventoryAlertType.description: Indicates whether Square should alert the merchant when the inventory quantity of a CatalogItemVariation is low.

x-enum-elements.name: PHYSICAL_COUNT
x-enum-elements.description: The change occurred as part of a physical count update.

x-enum-elements.name: ADJUSTMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
The change occurred as part of the normal lifecycle of goods
(e.g., as an inventory adjustment).

x-enum-elements.name: TRANSFER
x-enum-elements.description: The change occurred as part of an inventory transfer.

InventoryChangeType.description: Indicates how the inventory change was applied to a tracked product quantity.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOM
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are in a custom state. **READ-ONLY**:
the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: IN_STOCK
x-enum-elements.description: The related quantity of items are on hand and available for sale.

x-enum-elements.name: SOLD
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were sold as part of an itemized
transaction. Quantities in the `SOLD` state are no longer tracked.

x-enum-elements.name: RETURNED_BY_CUSTOMER
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were returned through the Square Point
of Sale application, but are not yet available for sale. **READ-ONLY**:
the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: RESERVED_FOR_SALE
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are on hand, but not currently
available for sale. **READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move
quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: SOLD_ONLINE
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were sold online. **READ-ONLY**: the
Inventory API cannot move quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDERED_FROM_VENDOR
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were ordered from a vendor but not yet
received. **READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move quantities to or
from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: RECEIVED_FROM_VENDOR
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were received from a vendor but are
not yet available for sale. **READ-ONLY**: the Inventory API cannot move
quantities to or from this state.

x-enum-elements.name: IN_TRANSIT_TO
x-enum-elements.description:
Replaced by `IN_TRANSIT` to represent quantities
of items that are in transit between locations.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description:
A placeholder indicating that the related quantity of items are not
currently tracked in Square. Transferring quantities from the `NONE` state
to a tracked state (e.g., `IN_STOCK`) introduces stock into the system.

x-enum-elements.name: WASTE
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items are lost or damaged and cannot be
sold.

x-enum-elements.name: UNLINKED_RETURN
x-enum-elements.description:
The related quantity of items were returned but not linked to a
previous transaction. Unlinked returns are not tracked in Square.
Transferring a quantity from `UNLINKED_RETURN` to a tracked state (e.g.,
`IN_STOCK`) introduces new stock into the system.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPOSED
x-enum-elements.description: The related quantity of items that are part of a composition consisting one or more components.

x-enum-elements.name: DECOMPOSED
x-enum-elements.description: The related quantity of items that are part of a component.

x-enum-elements.name: SUPPORTED_BY_NEWER_VERSION
x-enum-elements.description: This state is not supported by this version of the Square API. We recommend that you upgrade the client to use the appropriate version of the Square API supporting this state.

x-enum-elements.name: IN_TRANSIT
x-enum-elements.description: The related quantity of items are in transit between locations. **READ-ONLY:** the Inventory API cannot currently be used to move quantities to or from this inventory state.

InventoryState.description: Indicates the state of a tracked item quantity in the lifecycle of goods.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description: An automatic payment is not configured for the payment request.

x-enum-elements.name: CARD_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Use a card on file as the automatic payment method. On the due date, Square charges the card
for the amount of the payment request.

For `CARD_ON_FILE` payments, the invoice delivery method must be `EMAIL` and `card_id` must be
specified for the payment request before the invoice can be published.

x-enum-elements.name: BANK_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Use a bank account on file as the automatic payment method. On the due date, Square charges the bank
account for the amount of the payment request if the buyer has approved the payment. The buyer receives a
request to approve the payment when the invoice is sent or the invoice is updated.

This payment method applies only to invoices that sellers create in the Seller Dashboard or other
Square product. The bank account is provided by the customer during the payment flow. 

You cannot set `BANK_ON_FILE` as a payment method using the Invoices API, but you can change a `BANK_ON_FILE`
payment method to `NONE` or `CARD_ON_FILE`. For `BANK_ON_FILE` payments, the invoice delivery method must be `EMAIL`.

InvoiceAutomaticPaymentSource.description: Indicates the automatic payment method for an [invoice payment request](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/InvoicePaymentRequest).

x-enum-elements.name: ABOVE_LINE_ITEMS
x-enum-elements.description: Render the custom field above the invoice line items.

x-enum-elements.name: BELOW_LINE_ITEMS
x-enum-elements.description: Render the custom field below the invoice line items.

InvoiceCustomFieldPlacement.description:
Indicates where to render a custom field on the Square-hosted invoice page and in emailed or PDF 
copies of the invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: EMAIL
x-enum-elements.description: Directs Square to send invoices, reminders, and receipts to the customer using email.

x-enum-elements.name: SHARE_MANUALLY
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to take no action on the invoice. In this case, the seller
or application developer follows up with the customer for payment. For example,
a seller might collect a payment in the Seller Dashboard or Point of Sale (POS) application.
The seller might also share the URL of the Square-hosted invoice page (`public_url`) with the customer to request payment.

x-enum-elements.name: SMS
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to send invoices and receipts to the customer using SMS (text message).

You cannot set `SMS` as a delivery method using the Invoices API, but you can change an `SMS` delivery method to `EMAIL` or `SHARE_MANUALLY`.

InvoiceDeliveryMethod.description: Indicates how Square delivers the [invoice](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/Invoice) to the customer.

x-enum-elements.name: PENDING
x-enum-elements.description: The reminder will be sent on the `relative_scheduled_date` (if the invoice is published).

x-enum-elements.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
x-enum-elements.description:
The reminder is not applicable and is not sent. The following are examples
of when reminders are not applicable and are not sent:
- You schedule a reminder to be sent before the invoice is published.
- The invoice is configured with multiple payment requests and a payment request reminder
is configured to be sent after the next payment request `due_date`.
- Two reminders (for different payment requests) are configured to be sent on the
same date. Therefore, only one reminder is sent.
- You configure a reminder to be sent on the date that the invoice is scheduled to be sent.
- The payment request is already paid.
- The invoice status is `CANCELED` or `FAILED`.

x-enum-elements.name: SENT
x-enum-elements.description: The reminder is sent.

InvoicePaymentReminderStatus.description: The status of a payment request reminder.

x-enum-elements.name: EMAIL
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to send invoices, reminders, and receipts to the customer using email.
Square sends the invoice after it is published (either immediately or at the `scheduled_at`
time, if specified in the [invoice](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/Invoice)).

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGE_CARD_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to charge the card on file on the `due_date` specified in the payment request
and to use email to send invoices, reminders, and receipts.

x-enum-elements.name: SHARE_MANUALLY
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to take no specific action on the invoice. In this case, the seller 
(or the application developer) follows up with the customer for payment. For example, 
a seller might collect a payment in the Seller Dashboard or use the Point of Sale (POS) application. 
The seller might also share the URL of the Square-hosted invoice page (`public_url`) with the customer requesting payment.

x-enum-elements.name: CHARGE_BANK_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to charge the customer's bank account on file and to use email to send invoices, reminders, and receipts.
The customer must approve the payment.

The bank on file payment method applies only to invoices that sellers create in the Seller Dashboard or other
Square product. The bank account is provided by the customer during the payment flow. You 
cannot set `CHARGE_BANK_ON_FILE` as a request method using the Invoices API.

x-enum-elements.name: SMS
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to send invoices and receipts to the customer using SMS (text message). Square sends the invoice
after it is published (either immediately or at the `scheduled_at` time, if specified in the [invoice](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/Invoice)). 

You cannot set `SMS` as a request method using the Invoices API.

x-enum-elements.name: SMS_CHARGE_CARD_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to charge the card on file on the `due_date` specified in the payment request and to
use SMS (text message) to send invoices and receipts. 

You cannot set `SMS_CHARGE_CARD_ON_FILE` as a request method using the Invoices API.

x-enum-elements.name: SMS_CHARGE_BANK_ON_FILE
x-enum-elements.description:
Directs Square to charge the customer's bank account on file and to use SMS (text message) to send invoices and receipts.
The customer must approve the payment.

The bank on file payment method applies only to invoices that sellers create in the Seller Dashboard
or other Square product. The bank account is provided by the customer during the payment flow. 
You cannot set `SMS_CHARGE_BANK_ON_FILE` as a request method using the Invoices API.

InvoiceRequestMethod.description:
Specifies the action for Square to take for processing the invoice. For example, 
email the invoice, charge a customer's card on file, or do nothing. DEPRECATED at
version 2021-01-21. The corresponding `request_method` field is replaced by the
`Invoice.delivery_method` and `InvoicePaymentRequest.automatic_payment_source` fields.

x-enum-elements.name: BALANCE
x-enum-elements.description:
A request for a balance payment. The balance amount is computed as follows: 

- If the invoice specifies only a balance payment request, the balance amount is the 
total amount of the associated order. 
- If the invoice also specifies a deposit request, the balance amount is the amount 
remaining after the deposit.

`INSTALLMENT` and `BALANCE` payment requests are not allowed in the same invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: DEPOSIT
x-enum-elements.description:
A request for a deposit payment. You have the option of specifying 
an exact amount or a percentage of the total order amount. If you request a deposit, 
it must be due before any other payment requests.

x-enum-elements.name: INSTALLMENT
x-enum-elements.description:
A request for an installment payment. Installments allow buyers to pay the invoice over time. Installments can optionally be combined with a deposit. 

Adding `INSTALLMENT` payment requests to an invoice requires an 
[Invoices Plus subscription](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/invoices-api/overview#invoices-plus-subscription).

InvoiceRequestType.description:
Indicates the type of the payment request. For more information, see 
[Configuring payment requests](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/invoices-api/create-publish-invoices#payment-requests).

x-enum-elements.name: INVOICE_SORT_DATE
x-enum-elements.description:
The field works as follows:

- If the invoice is a draft, it uses the invoice `created_at` date.
- If the invoice is scheduled for publication, it uses the `scheduled_at` date.
- If the invoice is published, it uses the invoice publication date.

InvoiceSortField.description: The field to use for sorting.

x-enum-elements.name: DRAFT
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is a draft. You must publish a draft invoice before Square can process it.
A draft invoice has no `public_url`, so it is not available to customers.

x-enum-elements.name: UNPAID
x-enum-elements.description: The invoice is published but not yet paid.

x-enum-elements.name: SCHEDULED
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is scheduled to be processed. On the scheduled date,
Square sends the invoice, initiates an automatic payment, or takes no action, depending on
the delivery method and payment request settings. Square also sets the invoice status to the
appropriate state: `UNPAID`, `PAID`, `PARTIALLY_PAID`, or `PAYMENT_PENDING`.

x-enum-elements.name: PARTIALLY_PAID
x-enum-elements.description: A partial payment is received for the invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: PAID
x-enum-elements.description: The customer paid the invoice in full.

x-enum-elements.name: PARTIALLY_REFUNDED
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is paid (or partially paid) and some but not all the amount paid is
refunded.

x-enum-elements.name: REFUNDED
x-enum-elements.description: The full amount that the customer paid for the invoice is refunded.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description:
The invoice is canceled. Square no longer requests payments from the customer.
The `public_url` page remains and is accessible, but it displays the invoice
as canceled and does not accept payment.

x-enum-elements.name: FAILED
x-enum-elements.description: Square canceled the invoice due to suspicious activity.

x-enum-elements.name: PAYMENT_PENDING
x-enum-elements.description:
A payment on the invoice was initiated but has not yet been processed.

When in this state, invoices cannot be updated and other payments cannot be initiated.

InvoiceStatus.description: Indicates the status of an invoice.

x-enum-elements.name: NONE
x-enum-elements.description: The job does not have a defined pay type.

x-enum-elements.name: HOURLY
x-enum-elements.description: The job pays an hourly rate.

x-enum-elements.name: SALARY
x-enum-elements.description: The job pays an annual salary.

JobAssignmentPayType.description: Enumerates the possible pay types that a job can be assigned.

x-enum-elements.name: CREDIT_CARD_PROCESSING
x-enum-elements.description: The capability to process credit card transactions with Square.

x-enum-elements.name: AUTOMATIC_TRANSFERS
x-enum-elements.description: The capability to receive automatic transfers from Square.

x-enum-elements.name: UNLINKED_REFUNDS
x-enum-elements.description: The capability to process unlinked refunds with Square.

LocationCapability.description: The capabilities a location might have.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: A location that is active for business.

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
A location that is not active for business. Inactive locations provide historical
information. Hide inactive locations unless the user has requested to see them.

x-enum-elements.name: PHYSICAL
x-enum-elements.description: A place of business with a physical location.

x-enum-elements.name: MOBILE
x-enum-elements.description: A place of business that is mobile, such as a food truck or online store.

x-enum-elements.name: PHONE
x-enum-elements.description: The loyalty account is mapped by phone.

x-enum-elements.name: SQUARE
x-enum-elements.description: The event is generated by the Square Point of Sale (POS).

x-enum-elements.name: LOYALTY_API
x-enum-elements.description: The event is generated by something other than the Square Point of Sale that used the Loyalty API.

LoyaltyEventSource.description: Defines whether the event was generated by the Square Point of Sale.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCUMULATE_POINTS
x-enum-elements.description:
Points are added to a loyalty account for a purchase that
qualified for points based on an [accrual rule](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/LoyaltyProgramAccrualRule).

x-enum-elements.name: CREATE_REWARD
x-enum-elements.description: A [loyalty reward](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/LoyaltyReward) is created.

x-enum-elements.name: REDEEM_REWARD
x-enum-elements.description: A loyalty reward is redeemed.

x-enum-elements.name: DELETE_REWARD
x-enum-elements.description: A loyalty reward is deleted.

x-enum-elements.name: ADJUST_POINTS
x-enum-elements.description: Loyalty points are manually adjusted.

x-enum-elements.name: EXPIRE_POINTS
x-enum-elements.description:
Loyalty points are expired according to the 
expiration policy of the loyalty program.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER
x-enum-elements.description: Some other loyalty event occurred.

x-enum-elements.name: ACCUMULATE_PROMOTION_POINTS
x-enum-elements.description:
Points are added to a loyalty account for a purchase that
qualified for a [loyalty promotion](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/LoyaltyPromotion).

LoyaltyEventType.description: The type of the loyalty event.

x-enum-elements.name: BEFORE_TAX
x-enum-elements.description: Exclude taxes from the purchase amount used for loyalty points accrual.

x-enum-elements.name: AFTER_TAX
x-enum-elements.description: Include taxes in the purchase amount used for loyalty points accrual.

LoyaltyProgramAccrualRuleTaxMode.description:
Indicates how taxes should be treated when calculating the purchase amount used for loyalty points accrual. 
This setting applies only to `SPEND` accrual rules or `VISIT` accrual rules that have a minimum spend requirement.

x-enum-elements.name: VISIT
x-enum-elements.description:
A visit-based accrual rule. A buyer earns points for each visit. 
You can specify the minimum purchase required.

x-enum-elements.name: SPEND
x-enum-elements.description:
A spend-based accrual rule. A buyer earns points based on the amount 
spent.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_VARIATION
x-enum-elements.description:
An accrual rule based on an item variation. For example, accrue 
points for purchasing a coffee.

x-enum-elements.name: CATEGORY
x-enum-elements.description:
An accrual rule based on an item category. For example, accrue points 
for purchasing any item in the "hot drink" category: coffee, tea, or hot cocoa.

LoyaltyProgramAccrualRuleType.description: The type of the accrual rule that defines how buyers can earn points.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The discount applies to the entire order.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM_VARIATION
x-enum-elements.description: The discount applies only to specific item variations.

x-enum-elements.name: CATEGORY
x-enum-elements.description: The discount applies only to items in the given categories.

LoyaltyProgramRewardDefinitionScope.description:
Indicates the scope of the reward tier. DEPRECATED at version 2020-12-16. Discount details
are now defined using a catalog pricing rule and other catalog objects. For more information, see
[Getting discount details for a reward tier](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/loyalty-api/loyalty-rewards#get-discount-details).

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: The fixed amount discounted.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description: The fixed percentage discounted.

LoyaltyProgramRewardDefinitionType.description:
The type of discount the reward tier offers. DEPRECATED at version 2020-12-16. Discount details
are now defined using a catalog pricing rule and other catalog objects. For more information, see
[Getting discount details for a reward tier](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/loyalty-api/loyalty-rewards#get-discount-details).

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The loyalty program does not have an active subscription. 
Loyalty API requests fail.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: The program is fully functional. The program has an active subscription.

LoyaltyProgramStatus.description: Indicates whether the program is currently active.

x-enum-elements.name: POINTS_MULTIPLIER
x-enum-elements.description:
Multiply the number of points earned from the base loyalty program.
For example, "Earn double points."

x-enum-elements.name: POINTS_ADDITION
x-enum-elements.description:
Add a specified number of points to those earned from the base loyalty program.
For example, "Earn 10 additional points."

LoyaltyPromotionIncentiveType.description:
Indicates the type of points incentive for a [loyalty promotion](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/LoyaltyPromotion),
which is used to determine how buyers can earn points from the promotion.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The loyalty promotion is currently active. Buyers can earn points for purchases
that meet the promotion conditions, such as the promotion's `available_time`.

x-enum-elements.name: ENDED
x-enum-elements.description:
The loyalty promotion has ended because the specified `end_date` was reached.
`ENDED` is a terminal status.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: The loyalty promotion was canceled. `CANCELED` is a terminal status.

x-enum-elements.name: SCHEDULED
x-enum-elements.description:
The loyalty promotion is scheduled to start in the future. Square changes the
promotion status to `ACTIVE` when the `start_date` is reached.

x-enum-elements.name: ALL_TIME
x-enum-elements.description:
The limit applies to the entire time that the promotion is active. For example, if `times`
is set to 1 and `time_period` is set to `ALL_TIME`, a buyer can earn promotion points a maximum
of one time during the promotion.

x-enum-elements.name: DAY
x-enum-elements.description:
The limit applies per day, according to the `available_time` schedule specified for the promotion.
For example, if the `times` field of the trigger limit is set to 1, a buyer can trigger the promotion
a maximum of once per day.

LoyaltyPromotionTriggerLimitInterval.description:
Indicates the time period that the [trigger limit](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/LoyaltyPromotionTriggerLimit) applies to,
which is used to determine the number of times a buyer can earn points for a [loyalty promotion](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/LoyaltyPromotion).

x-enum-elements.name: ISSUED
x-enum-elements.description: The reward is issued.

x-enum-elements.name: REDEEMED
x-enum-elements.description: The reward is redeemed.

x-enum-elements.name: DELETED
x-enum-elements.description: The reward is deleted.

LoyaltyRewardStatus.description: The status of the loyalty reward.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_ACRE
x-enum-elements.description: The area is measured in acres.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_SQUARE_INCH
x-enum-elements.description: The area is measured in square inches.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_SQUARE_FOOT
x-enum-elements.description: The area is measured in square feet.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_SQUARE_YARD
x-enum-elements.description: The area is measured in square yards.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_SQUARE_MILE
x-enum-elements.description: The area is measured in square miles.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_SQUARE_CENTIMETER
x-enum-elements.description: The area is measured in square centimeters.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_SQUARE_METER
x-enum-elements.description: The area is measured in square meters.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_SQUARE_KILOMETER
x-enum-elements.description: The area is measured in square kilometers.

MeasurementUnitArea.description: Unit of area used to measure a quantity.

x-enum-elements.name: UNIT
x-enum-elements.description: The generic unit.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_INCH
x-enum-elements.description: The length is measured in inches.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_FOOT
x-enum-elements.description: The length is measured in feet.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_YARD
x-enum-elements.description: The length is measured in yards.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_MILE
x-enum-elements.description: The length is measured in miles.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_MILLIMETER
x-enum-elements.description: The length is measured in millimeters.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_CENTIMETER
x-enum-elements.description: The length is measured in centimeters.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_METER
x-enum-elements.description: The length is measured in meters.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_KILOMETER
x-enum-elements.description: The length is measured in kilometers.

MeasurementUnitLength.description: The unit of length used to measure a quantity.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_MILLISECOND
x-enum-elements.description: The time is measured in milliseconds.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_SECOND
x-enum-elements.description: The time is measured in seconds.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_MINUTE
x-enum-elements.description: The time is measured in minutes.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_HOUR
x-enum-elements.description: The time is measured in hours.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_DAY
x-enum-elements.description: The time is measured in days.

MeasurementUnitTime.description: Unit of time used to measure a quantity (a duration).

x-enum-elements.name: TYPE_CUSTOM
x-enum-elements.description: The unit details are contained in the custom_unit field.

x-enum-elements.name: TYPE_AREA
x-enum-elements.description: The unit details are contained in the area_unit field.

x-enum-elements.name: TYPE_LENGTH
x-enum-elements.description: The unit details are contained in the length_unit field.

x-enum-elements.name: TYPE_VOLUME
x-enum-elements.description: The unit details are contained in the volume_unit field.

x-enum-elements.name: TYPE_WEIGHT
x-enum-elements.description: The unit details are contained in the weight_unit field.

x-enum-elements.name: TYPE_GENERIC
x-enum-elements.description: The unit details are contained in the generic_unit field.

MeasurementUnitUnitType.description: Describes the type of this unit and indicates which field contains the unit information. This is an â€˜openâ€™ enum.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_FLUID_OUNCE
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in ounces.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_SHOT
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in shots.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_CUP
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in cups.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_PINT
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in pints.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_QUART
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in quarts.

x-enum-elements.name: GENERIC_GALLON
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in gallons.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_CUBIC_INCH
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in cubic inches.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_CUBIC_FOOT
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in cubic feet.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_CUBIC_YARD
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in cubic yards.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_MILLILITER
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in metric milliliters.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_LITER
x-enum-elements.description: The volume is measured in metric liters.

MeasurementUnitVolume.description: The unit of volume used to measure a quantity.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_WEIGHT_OUNCE
x-enum-elements.description: The weight is measured in ounces.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_POUND
x-enum-elements.description: The weight is measured in pounds.

x-enum-elements.name: IMPERIAL_STONE
x-enum-elements.description: The weight is measured in stones.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_MILLIGRAM
x-enum-elements.description: The weight is measured in milligrams.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_GRAM
x-enum-elements.description: The weight is measured in grams.

x-enum-elements.name: METRIC_KILOGRAM
x-enum-elements.description: The weight is measured in kilograms.

MeasurementUnitWeight.description: Unit of weight used to measure a quantity.

x-enum-elements.name: ACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description: A fully operational merchant account. The merchant can interact with Square products and APIs.

x-enum-elements.name: INACTIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
A functionally limited merchant account. The merchant can only have limited interaction
via Square APIs. The merchant cannot log in or access the seller dashboard.

x-enum-elements.name: SCHEDULED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates the fulfillment to deliver at a scheduled deliver time.

x-enum-elements.name: ASAP
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the fulfillment to deliver as soon as possible and should be prepared
immediately.

OrderFulfillmentDeliveryDetailsScheduleT.description: The schedule type of the delivery fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: ALL
x-enum-elements.description: If `ALL`, `entries` must be unset.

x-enum-elements.name: ENTRY_LIST
x-enum-elements.description: If `ENTRY_LIST`, supply a list of `entries`.

OrderFulfillmentFulfillmentLineItemAppli.description:
The `line_item_application` describes what order line items this fulfillment applies
to. It can be `ALL` or `ENTRY_LIST` with a supplied list of fulfillment entries.

x-enum-elements.name: SCHEDULED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment will be picked up at a scheduled pickup time.

x-enum-elements.name: ASAP
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the fulfillment will be picked up as soon as possible and
should be prepared immediately.

OrderFulfillmentPickupDetailsScheduleTyp.description: The schedule type of the pickup fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: PROPOSED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment has been proposed.

x-enum-elements.name: RESERVED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment has been reserved.

x-enum-elements.name: PREPARED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment has been prepared.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLETED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment was successfully completed.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the fulfillment was canceled.

x-enum-elements.name: FAILED
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the fulfillment failed to be completed, but was not explicitly
canceled.

OrderFulfillmentState.description: The current state of this fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: PICKUP
x-enum-elements.description: A recipient to pick up the fulfillment from a physical [location](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/Location).

x-enum-elements.name: SHIPMENT
x-enum-elements.description: A shipping carrier to ship the fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: DELIVERY
x-enum-elements.description: A courier to deliver the fulfillment.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_DISCOUNT_SCOPE
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction discount scope is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: LINE_ITEM
x-enum-elements.description:
The discount should be applied to only line items specified by
`OrderLineItemAppliedDiscount` reference records.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The discount should be applied to the entire order.

OrderLineItemDiscountScope.description: Indicates whether this is a line-item or order-level discount.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_DISCOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction discount type is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a fixed percentage (such as 5%) off the item price.

x-enum-elements.name: FIXED_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: Apply the discount as a fixed monetary value (such as $1.00) off the item price.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE
x-enum-elements.description:
Apply the discount as a variable percentage based on the item
price.

The specific discount percentage of a `VARIABLE_PERCENTAGE` discount
is assigned at the time of the purchase.

x-enum-elements.name: VARIABLE_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description:
Apply the discount as a variable amount based on the item price.

The specific discount amount of a `VARIABLE_AMOUNT` discount
is assigned at the time of the purchase.

OrderLineItemDiscountType.description: Indicates how the discount is applied to the associated line item or order.

x-enum-elements.name: ITEM
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the line item is an itemized sale.

x-enum-elements.name: CUSTOM_AMOUNT
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the line item is a non-itemized sale.

x-enum-elements.name: GIFT_CARD
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the line item is a gift card sale. Gift cards sold through
the Orders API are sold in an unactivated state and can be activated through the
Gift Cards API using the line item `uid`.

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_TAX_SCOPE
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction tax scope is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: LINE_ITEM
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax should be applied only to line items specified by
the `OrderLineItemAppliedTax` reference records.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The tax should be applied to the entire order.

OrderLineItemTaxScope.description: Indicates whether this is a line-item or order-level tax.

x-enum-elements.name: UNKNOWN_TAX
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction tax type is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: ADDITIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an additive tax. The tax amount is added on top of the price.
For example, an item with a cost of 1.00 USD and a 10% additive tax has a total
cost to the buyer of 1.10 USD.

x-enum-elements.name: INCLUSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an inclusive tax. Inclusive taxes are already included
in the line item price or order total. For example, an item with a cost of
1.00 USD and a 10% inclusive tax has a pretax cost of 0.91 USD
(91 cents) and a 0.09 (9 cents) tax for a total cost of 1.00 USD to
the buyer.

OrderLineItemTaxType.description: Indicates how the tax is applied to the associated line item or order.

x-enum-elements.name: SUBTOTAL_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description:
The service charge is applied after discounts, but before
taxes.

x-enum-elements.name: TOTAL_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description:
The service charge is applied after all discounts and taxes
are applied.

x-enum-elements.name: APPORTIONED_PERCENTAGE_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description:
The service charge is calculated as a compounding adjustment
after any discounts, but before amount based apportioned service charges
and any tax considerations.

x-enum-elements.name: APPORTIONED_AMOUNT_PHASE
x-enum-elements.description:
The service charge is calculated as a compounding adjustment
after any discounts and percentage based apportioned service charges,
but before any tax considerations.

OrderServiceChargeCalculationPhase.description:
Represents a phase in the process of calculating order totals.
Service charges are applied after the indicated phase.

[Read more about how order totals are calculated.](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/orders-api/how-it-works#how-totals-are-calculated)

x-enum-elements.name: OTHER_SERVICE_CHARGE_SCOPE
x-enum-elements.description:
Used for reporting only.
The original transaction service charge scope is currently not supported by the API.

x-enum-elements.name: LINE_ITEM
x-enum-elements.description:
The service charge should be applied to only line items specified by
`OrderLineItemAppliedServiceCharge` reference records.

x-enum-elements.name: ORDER
x-enum-elements.description: The service charge should be applied to the entire order.

OrderServiceChargeScope.description:
Indicates whether this is a line-item or order-level apportioned
service charge.

OrderServiceChargeTreatmentType.description:
Indicates whether the service charge will be treated as a value-holding line item or
apportioned toward a line item.

x-enum-elements.name: OPEN
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the order is open. Open orders can be updated.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLETED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the order is completed. Completed orders are fully paid. This is a terminal state.

x-enum-elements.name: CANCELED
x-enum-elements.description: Indicates that the order is canceled. Canceled orders are not paid. This is a terminal state.

x-enum-elements.name: DRAFT
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the order is in a draft state. Draft orders can be updated,
but cannot be paid or fulfilled.
For more information, see [Create Orders](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/orders-api/create-orders).

x-enum-elements.name: CANCEL
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the payment should be automatically canceled when the delay duration
elapses.

x-enum-elements.name: COMPLETE
x-enum-elements.description:
Indicates that the payment should be automatically completed when the delay duration
elapses.

x-enum-elements.name: ADDITIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an additive tax. The tax amount is added on top of the
CatalogItemVariation price. For example, a $1.00 item with a 10% additive
tax would have a total cost to the buyer of $1.10.

x-enum-elements.name: INCLUSIVE
x-enum-elements.description:
The tax is an inclusive tax. The tax amount is included in the
CatalogItemVariation price. For example, a $1.00 item with a 10% inclusive
tax would have a total cost to the buyer of $1.00, with $0.91 (91 cents) of
that total being the cost of the item and $0.09 (9 cents) being tax.

TaxInclusionType.description: Whether to the tax amount should be additional to or included in the CatalogItem price.

location_id.description: The location ID for a recipient (other than the merchant) receiving a portion of this tender.

description.description: The description of the additional recipient.

amount_money.description: The amount of money distributed to the recipient.

receivable_id.description: The unique ID for the RETIRED `AdditionalRecipientReceivable` object. This field should be empty for any `AdditionalRecipient` objects created after the retirement.

AdditionalRecipient.description: Represents an additional recipient (other than the merchant) receiving a portion of this tender.

address_line_1.description:
The first line of the address.

Fields that start with `address_line` provide the address's most specific
details, like street number, street name, and building name. They do *not*
provide less specific details like city, state/province, or country (these
details are provided in other fields).

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address, if any.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if any.

locality.description: The city or town of the address. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

sublocality.description: A civil region within the address's `locality`, if any.

sublocality_2.description: A civil region within the address's `sublocality`, if any.

sublocality_3.description: A civil region within the address's `sublocality_2`, if any.

administrative_district_level_1.description:
A civil entity within the address's country. In the US, this
is the state. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

administrative_district_level_2.description:
A civil entity within the address's `administrative_district_level_1`.
In the US, this is the county.

administrative_district_level_3.description:
A civil entity within the address's `administrative_district_level_2`,
if any.

postal_code.description: The address's postal code. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

country.description: The address's country, in the two-letter format of ISO 3166. For example, `US` or `FR`.

first_name.description: Optional first name when it's representing recipient.

last_name.description: Optional last name when it's representing recipient.

Address.description:
Represents a postal address in a country. 
For more information, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

idempotency_key.description:
A unique string that identifies this `AdjustLoyaltyPoints` request. 
Keys can be any valid string, but must be unique for every request.

adjust_points.description:
The points to add or subtract and the reason for the adjustment. To add points, specify a positive integer.
To subtract points, specify a negative integer.

allow_negative_balance.description:
Indicates whether to allow a negative adjustment to result in a negative balance. If `true`, a negative
balance is allowed when subtracting points. If `false`, Square returns a `BAD_REQUEST` error when subtracting
the specified number of points would result in a negative balance. The default value is `false`.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

event.description: The resulting event data for the adjustment.

email_address.description: Email address on the buyer's Afterpay account.

square_product.description:
The Square product, such as Square Point of Sale (POS), 
Square Invoices, or Square Virtual Terminal.

application_id.description:
The Square ID assigned to the application used to take the payment. 
Application developers can use this information to identify payments that 
their application processed. 
For example, if a developer uses a custom application to process payments, 
this field contains the application ID from the Developer Dashboard. 
If a seller uses a [Square App Marketplace](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/app-marketplace) 
application to process payments, the field contains the corresponding application ID.

ApplicationDetails.description: Details about the application that took the payment.

duration_minutes.description: The time span in minutes of an appointment segment.

service_variation_id.description: The ID of the [CatalogItemVariation](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/CatalogItemVariation) object representing the service booked in this segment.

team_member_id.description: The ID of the [TeamMember](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/TeamMember) object representing the team member booked in this segment.

service_variation_version.description: The current version of the item variation representing the service booked in this segment.

intermission_minutes.description: Time between the end of this segment and the beginning of the subsequent segment.

any_team_member.description: Whether the customer accepts any team member, instead of a specific one, to serve this segment.

resource_ids.description: The IDs of the seller-accessible resources used for this appointment segment.

AppointmentSegment.description: Defines an appointment segment of a booking.

start_at.description: The RFC 3339 timestamp specifying the beginning time of the slot available for booking.

location_id.description: The ID of the location available for booking.

appointment_segments.description: The list of appointment segments available for booking

Availability.description: Defines an appointment slot that encapsulates the appointment segments, location and starting time available for booking.

id.description: The unique, Square-issued identifier for the bank account.

account_number_suffix.description: The last few digits of the account number.

country.description: The ISO 3166 Alpha-2 country code where the bank account is based.

currency.description:
The 3-character ISO 4217 currency code indicating the operating
currency of the bank account. For example, the currency code for US dollars
is `USD`.

account_type.description: The financial purpose of the associated bank account.

holder_name.description:
Name of the account holder. This name must match the name 
on the targeted bank account record.

primary_bank_identification_number.description:
Primary identifier for the bank. For more information, see 
[Bank Accounts API](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/bank-accounts-api).

secondary_bank_identification_number.description:
Secondary identifier for the bank. For more information, see 
[Bank Accounts API](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/bank-accounts-api).

debit_mandate_reference_id.description:
Reference identifier that will be displayed to UK bank account owners
when collecting direct debit authorization. Only required for UK bank accounts.

reference_id.description:
Client-provided identifier for linking the banking account to an entity
in a third-party system (for example, a bank account number or a user identifier).

location_id.description: The location to which the bank account belongs.

status.description: Read-only. The current verification status of this BankAccount object.

creditable.description: Indicates whether it is possible for Square to send money to this bank account.

debitable.description:
Indicates whether it is possible for Square to take money from this 
bank account.

fingerprint.description:
A Square-assigned, unique identifier for the bank account based on the
account information. The account fingerprint can be used to compare account
entries and determine if the they represent the same real-world bank account.

version.description: The current version of the `BankAccount`.

bank_name.description:
Read only. Name of actual financial institution. 
For example "Bank of America".

BankAccount.description:
Represents a bank account. For more information about 
linking a bank account to a Square account, see 
[Bank Accounts API](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/bank-accounts-api).

bank_name.description: The name of the bank associated with the bank account.

transfer_type.description: The type of the bank transfer. The type can be `ACH` or `UNKNOWN`.

account_ownership_type.description:
The ownership type of the bank account performing the transfer.
The type can be `INDIVIDUAL`, `COMPANY`, or `ACCOUNT_TYPE_UNKNOWN`.

fingerprint.description:
Uniquely identifies the bank account for this seller and can be used
to determine if payments are from the same bank account.

country.description: The two-letter ISO code representing the country the bank account is located in.

statement_description.description: The statement description as sent to the bank.

ach_details.description:
ACH-specific information about the transfer. The information is only populated
if the `transfer_type` is `ACH`.

errors.description: Information about errors encountered during the request.

BankAccountPaymentDetails.description: Additional details about BANK_ACCOUNT type payments.

idempotency_key.description:
A client-supplied, universally unique identifier (UUID) for the
request.

See [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency) in the
[API Development 101](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/buildbasics) section for more
information.

changes.description:
The set of physical counts and inventory adjustments to be made.
Changes are applied based on the client-supplied timestamp and may be sent
out of order.

ignore_unchanged_counts.description:
Indicates whether the current physical count should be ignored if
the quantity is unchanged since the last physical count. Default: `true`.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

counts.description: The current counts for all objects referenced in the request.

object_ids.description:
The IDs of the CatalogObjects to be deleted. When an object is deleted, other objects
in the graph that depend on that object will be deleted as well (for example, deleting a
CatalogItem will delete its CatalogItemVariation.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

deleted_object_ids.description: The IDs of all CatalogObjects deleted by this request.

deleted_at.description: The database [timestamp](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-dates) of this deletion in RFC 3339 format, e.g., "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z".

object_ids.description: The IDs of the CatalogObjects to be retrieved.

include_related_objects.description:
If `true`, the response will include additional objects that are related to the
requested objects. Related objects are defined as any objects referenced by ID by the results in the `objects` field
of the response. These objects are put in the `related_objects` field. Setting this to `true` is
helpful when the objects are needed for immediate display to a user.
This process only goes one level deep. Objects referenced by the related objects will not be included. For example,

if the `objects` field of the response contains a CatalogItem, its associated
CatalogCategory objects, CatalogTax objects, CatalogImage objects and
CatalogModifierLists will be returned in the `related_objects` field of the
response. If the `objects` field of the response contains a CatalogItemVariation,
its parent CatalogItem will be returned in the `related_objects` field of
the response.

Default value: `false`

catalog_version.description:
The specific version of the catalog objects to be included in the response. 
This allows you to retrieve historical versions of objects. The specified version value is matched against
the [CatalogObject](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/CatalogObject)s' `version` attribute. If not included, results will
be from the current version of the catalog.

include_deleted_objects.description: Indicates whether to include (`true`) or not (`false`) in the response deleted objects, namely, those with the `is_deleted` attribute set to `true`.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

related_objects.description: A list of [CatalogObject](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/CatalogObject)s referenced by the object in the `objects` field.

catalog_object_ids.description:
The filter to return results by `CatalogObject` ID.
The filter is only applicable when set. The default value is null.

location_ids.description:
The filter to return results by `Location` ID.
The filter is only applicable when set. The default value is null.

types.description:
The filter to return results by `InventoryChangeType` values other than `TRANSFER`.
The default value is `[PHYSICAL_COUNT, ADJUSTMENT]`.

states.description:
The filter to return `ADJUSTMENT` query results by
`InventoryState`. This filter is only applied when set.
The default value is null.

updated_after.description:
The filter to return results with their `calculated_at` value
after the given time as specified in an RFC 3339 timestamp.
The default value is the UNIX epoch of (`1970-01-01T00:00:00Z`).

updated_before.description:
The filter to return results with their `created_at` or `calculated_at` value
strictly before the given time as specified in an RFC 3339 timestamp.
The default value is the UNIX epoch of (`1970-01-01T00:00:00Z`).

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint.
Provide this to retrieve the next set of results for the original query.

See the [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination) guide for more information.

limit.description: The number of [records](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/InventoryChange) to return.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

changes.description:
The current calculated inventory changes for the requested objects
and locations.

cursor.description:
The pagination cursor to be used in a subsequent request. If unset,
this is the final response.
See the [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination) guide for more information.

catalog_object_ids.description:
The filter to return results by `CatalogObject` ID.
The filter is applicable only when set.  The default is null.

location_ids.description:
The filter to return results by `Location` ID.
This filter is applicable only when set. The default is null.

updated_after.description:
The filter to return results with their `calculated_at` value
after the given time as specified in an RFC 3339 timestamp.
The default value is the UNIX epoch of (`1970-01-01T00:00:00Z`).

cursor.description:
A pagination cursor returned by a previous call to this endpoint.
Provide this to retrieve the next set of results for the original query.

See the [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination) guide for more information.

states.description:
The filter to return results by `InventoryState`. The filter is only applicable when set.
Ignored are untracked states of `NONE`, `SOLD`, and `UNLINKED_RETURN`.
The default is null.

limit.description: The number of [records](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/InventoryCount) to return.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

counts.description:
The current calculated inventory counts for the requested objects
and locations.

cursor.description:
The pagination cursor to be used in a subsequent request. If unset,
this is the final response.

See the [Pagination](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/working-with-apis/pagination) guide for more information.

location_id.description:
The ID of the location for these orders. This field is optional: omit it to retrieve
orders within the scope of the current authorization's merchant ID.

order_ids.description: The IDs of the orders to retrieve. A maximum of 100 orders can be retrieved per request.

BatchRetrieveOrdersRequest.description:
Defines the fields that are included in requests to the
`BatchRetrieveOrders` endpoint.

orders.description: The requested orders. This will omit any requested orders that do not exist.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

BatchRetrieveOrdersResponse.description:
Defines the fields that are included in the response body of
a request to the `BatchRetrieveOrders` endpoint.

idempotency_key.description:
A value you specify that uniquely identifies this
request among all your requests. A common way to create
a valid idempotency key is to use a Universally unique
identifier (UUID).

If you're unsure whether a particular request was successful,
you can reattempt it with the same idempotency key without
worrying about creating duplicate objects.

See [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency) for more information.

batches.description:
A batch of CatalogObjects to be inserted/updated atomically.
The objects within a batch will be inserted in an all-or-nothing fashion, i.e., if an error occurs
attempting to insert or update an object within a batch, the entire batch will be rejected. However, an error
in one batch will not affect other batches within the same request.

For each object, its `updated_at` field is ignored and replaced with a current [timestamp](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-dates), and its
`is_deleted` field must not be set to `true`.

To modify an existing object, supply its ID. To create a new object, use an ID starting
with `#`. These IDs may be used to create relationships between an object and attributes of
other objects that reference it. For example, you can create a CatalogItem with
ID `#ABC` and a CatalogItemVariation with its `item_id` attribute set to
`#ABC` in order to associate the CatalogItemVariation with its parent
CatalogItem.

Any `#`-prefixed IDs are valid only within a single atomic batch, and will be replaced by server-generated IDs.

Each batch may contain up to 1,000 objects. The total number of objects across all batches for a single request
may not exceed 10,000. If either of these limits is violated, an error will be returned and no objects will
be inserted or updated.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred during the request.

updated_at.description: The database [timestamp](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-dates) of this update in RFC 3339 format, e.g., "2016-09-04T23:59:33.123Z".

id_mappings.description: The mapping between client and server IDs for this upsert.

id.description: A unique ID of this object representing a booking.

version.description: The revision number for the booking used for optimistic concurrency.

status.description: The status of the booking, describing where the booking stands with respect to the booking state machine.

created_at.description: The RFC 3339 timestamp specifying the creation time of this booking.

updated_at.description: The RFC 3339 timestamp specifying the most recent update time of this booking.

start_at.description: The RFC 3339 timestamp specifying the starting time of this booking.

location_id.description: The ID of the [Location](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/Location) object representing the location where the booked service is provided. Once set when the booking is created, its value cannot be changed.

customer_id.description: The ID of the [Customer](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/Customer) object representing the customer receiving the booked service.

customer_note.description: The free-text field for the customer to supply notes about the booking. For example, the note can be preferences that cannot be expressed by supported attributes of a relevant [CatalogObject](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/CatalogObject) instance.

seller_note.description:
The free-text field for the seller to supply notes about the booking. For example, the note can be preferences that cannot be expressed by supported attributes of a specific [CatalogObject](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/CatalogObject) instance.
This field should not be visible to customers.

appointment_segments.description: A list of appointment segments for this booking.

transition_time_minutes.description:
Additional time at the end of a booking.
Applications should not make this field visible to customers of a seller.

all_day.description: Whether the booking is of a full business day.

location_type.description:
The type of location where the booking is held.
Access to this field requires seller-level permissions.

source.description:
The source of the booking.
Access to this field requires seller-level permissions.

Booking.description:
Represents a booking as a time-bound service contract for a seller's staff member to provide a specified service
at a given location to a requesting customer in one or more appointment segments.

creator_type.description: The seller-accessible type of the creator of the booking.

team_member_id.description:
The ID of the team member who created the booking, when the booking creator is of the `TEAM_MEMBER` type.
Access to this field requires seller-level permissions.

customer_id.description:
The ID of the customer who created the booking, when the booking creator is of the `CUSTOMER` type.
Access to this field requires seller-level permissions.

key.description:
The key of the custom attribute to delete. This key must match the `key` of a
custom attribute definition in the Square seller account. If the requesting application is not
the definition owner, you must use the qualified key.

BookingCustomAttributeDeleteRequest.description:
Represents an individual delete request in a [BulkDeleteBookingCustomAttributes](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/booking-custom-attributes-api/bulk-delete-booking-custom-attributes)
request. An individual request contains a booking ID, the custom attribute to delete, and an optional idempotency key.

booking_id.description: The ID of the [booking](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/Booking) associated with the custom attribute.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred while processing the individual request.

BookingCustomAttributeDeleteResponse.description: Represents a response for an individual upsert request in a [BulkDeleteBookingCustomAttributes](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/booking-custom-attributes-api/bulk-delete-booking-custom-attributes) operation.

custom_attribute.description:
The custom attribute to create or update, with following fields:

- `key`. This key must match the `key` of a custom attribute definition in the Square seller
account. If the requesting application is not the definition owner, you must provide the qualified key.

- `value`. This value must conform to the `schema` specified by the definition.
For more information, see [Value data types](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/booking-custom-attributes-api/custom-attributes#value-data-types).

- `version`. To enable [optimistic concurrency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/optimistic-concurrency)
control for update operations, include this optional field in the request and set the
value to the current version of the custom attribute.

idempotency_key.description:
A unique identifier for this individual upsert request, used to ensure idempotency.
For more information, see [Idempotency](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/common-api-patterns/idempotency).

BookingCustomAttributeUpsertRequest.description:
Represents an individual upsert request in a [BulkUpsertBookingCustomAttributes](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/booking-custom-attributes-api/bulk-upsert-booking-custom-attributes)
request. An individual request contains a booking ID, the custom attribute to create or update,
and an optional idempotency key.

booking_id.description: The ID of the [booking](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/objects/Booking) associated with the custom attribute.

custom_attribute.description: The new or updated custom attribute.

errors.description: Any errors that occurred while processing the individual request.

BookingCustomAttributeUpsertResponse.description: Represents a response for an individual upsert request in a [BulkUpsertBookingCustomAttributes](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2023-07-20/booking-custom-attributes-api/bulk-upsert-booking-custom-attributes) operation.

id.description: The UUID for this object.

start_at.description:
RFC 3339; follows the same timezone information as `Shift`. Precision up to
the minute is respected; seconds are truncated.

end_at.description:
RFC 3339; follows the same timezone information as `Shift`. Precision up to
the minute is respected; seconds are truncated.

break_type_id.description: The `BreakType` that this `Break` was templated on.

name.description: A human-readable name.

expected_duration.description:
Format: RFC-3339 P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S. The expected length of
the break.

is_paid.description:
Whether this break counts towards time worked for compensation
purposes.

Break.description: A record of an employee's break during a shift.

id.description: The UUID for this object.

location_id.description: The ID of the business location this type of break applies to.

break_name.description:
A human-readable name for this type of break. The name is displayed to
employees in Square products.

expected_duration.description:
Format: RFC-3339 P[n]Y[n]M[n]DT[n]H[n]M[n]S. The expected length of
this break. Precision less than minutes is truncated.

Example for break expected duration of 15 minutes: T15M

is_paid.description:
Whether this break counts towards time worked for compensation
purposes.

version.description:
Used for resolving concurrency issues. The request fails if the version
provided does not match the server version at the time of the request. If a value is not
provided, Square's servers execute a "blind" write; potentially
overwriting another writer's data.

created_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: A read-only timestamp in RFC 3339 format.

BreakType.description:
A defined break template that sets an expectation for possible `Break`
instances on a `Shift`.

team_members.description: The data used to create the `TeamMember` objects. Each key is the `idempotency_key` that maps to the `CreateTeamMemberRequest`. The maximum number of create objects is 25.

BulkCreateTeamMembersRequest.description: Represents a bulk create request for `TeamMember` objects.
